item.title: Insider Threat: Tackling the Complex Challenges of the Enemy Within
item.dc:creator: Kevin Townsend
item.description:
The insider threat problem will worsen, and the solutions will widen, in the age of generative-AI.

The post Insider Threat: Tackling the Complex Challenges of the Enemy Within appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Industry Moves for the week of January 6, 2025 - SecurityWeek
item.description: Explore industry moves and significant changes in the industry for the week of January 6, 2025. Stay updated with the latest industry trends and shifts.

item.title: New Labels Will Help People Pick Devices Less at Risk of Hacking
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description:
The US government is rolling out a consumer labeling system designed to help Americans pick smart devices that are less vulnerable to hacking.

The post New Labels Will Help People Pick Devices Less at Risk of Hacking appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: CISA Warns of Mitel MiCollab Vulnerabilities Exploited in Attacks
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
CISA says two recently disclosed path traversal vulnerabilities in the Mitel MiCollab collaboration platform have been exploited in attacks.

The post CISA Warns of Mitel MiCollab Vulnerabilities Exploited in Attacks appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Chrome 131, Firefox 134 Updates Patch High-Severity Vulnerabilities
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Chrome and Firefox updates released this week resolve high-severity vulnerabilities in the two popular browsers.

The post Chrome 131, Firefox 134 Updates Patch High-Severity Vulnerabilities appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: First Android Update of 2025 Patches Critical Code Execution Vulnerabilities
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
This year’s first batch of monthly security updates for Android resolves 36 vulnerabilities, including critical remote code execution flaws.

The post First Android Update of 2025 Patches Critical Code Execution Vulnerabilities appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Veracode Targets Malicious Code Threats With Phylum Acquisition
item.dc:creator: Ryan Naraine
item.description:
The deal includes certain Phylum assets, including its malicious package analysis, detection, and mitigation technology. 

The post Veracode Targets Malicious Code Threats With Phylum Acquisition appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Trolley Problem, Safety Versus Security of Generative AI
item.dc:creator: Matt Honea
item.description:
The only way to advance AI safety is to increase human interactions, human values and societal governance to promote a reinforced human feedback loop, much like we do with traditional AI training methods.

The post Trolley Problem, Safety Versus Security of Generative AI appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Former NSA Director Rob Joyce Joins DataTribe as Venture Partner
item.dc:creator: SecurityWeek News
item.description:
DataTribe said Joyce will be a venture partner tasked with finding entrepreneurs developing new and emerging technologies for cyber defense.

The post Former NSA Director Rob Joyce Joins DataTribe as Venture Partner appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Chinese Tech Companies Tencent, CATL and Others Protest US Listings as Army-Linked Companies
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description:
The U.S. Defense Department added dozens of Chinese companies, including Tencent, SenseTime and battery maker CATL, to a list of companies it says have ties to China’s military.

The post Chinese Tech Companies Tencent, CATL and Others Protest US Listings as Army-Linked Companies appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Dell, HPE, MediaTek Patch Vulnerabilities in Their Products
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
MediaTek, HPE and Dell release advisories to inform customers about potentially serious vulnerabilities found and patched in their products.

The post Dell, HPE, MediaTek Patch Vulnerabilities in Their Products appeared first on SecurityWeek.
